text: Aubregrinia is a genus of plant in the family Sapotaceae first described as a genus in 1935.Aubréville, André & Pellegrin, François. 1935. Endotricha. Bulletin de la Société Botanique de France 81: 794Heine, Hermann Heino. 1960. Kew Bulletin 14: 301Tropicos, Aubregrinia Heine There is only one known species, Aubregrinia taiensis native to West Africa (Ghana, Liberia, Ivory Coast).Kew World Checklist of Selected Plant FamiliesGovaerts, R., Frodin, D.G. & Pennington, D. (2001 publ. 2002). World Checklist and Bibliography of Sapotaceae: 1-364. The Board of Trustees of the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew. The species is listed as critically endangered.Assi, A. 1998. Aubregrinia taiensis. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 20 August 2007. ==References== Category:Sapotaceae genera Category:Monotypic asterid genera Category:Flora of West Tropical Africa Category:Critically endangered plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Aubregrinia
